intro: Nothobaccaurea pulvinata, commonly known as the Pacific coast hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Pacific Northwest. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and often have a waxy texture. Nothobaccaurea pulvinata is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
